data.title: Replace: viewlet size broken when replace expanded
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8184

Check how this is done for when the search details are expanded, you need to accomodate this in the layouting of the viewlet:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/16417695/227cb378-3d47-11e6-948f-6446d3b7acb6.png)

data.title: Dragging a folder onto  a tab should not show drop acceptance feedback
data.body:
testing #7852 
- select a folder in the explorer
- drag it onto a tab

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/16417502/6ff336be-3d46-11e6-8c4f-758658f9c81c.png)

-> the tab shows acceptance feedback, but when dropping the folder nothing happens, except some temporary flickering.

I would have expect that no drop acceptance feedback is shown.

data.title: Warnings generated in VSCode Readme.md
data.body:
#7945
- VSCode Version: Insiders d0c2b891903d73e83dcdc7786398ebfa764fc4ee
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open vscode repository
2. Open README.md 

Following warnings are generated. I do not see them on May build. 

![warnings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/16417458/47817a2e-3d46-11e6-895c-c189ae3194f0.png)

data.title: don't type check dependencies when there are syntax errors
data.body:
re #8203
- cause a syntax error - remove the `{` of a class declaration
- many files get checked, result is little useful cos the syntax error is leading to false errors

data.title: replace settings variables in debugger config #8042
big type check when class internals change
data.body:
re #8203
- open `src/vs/base/common/event.ts`
- add a private field/copy `_disposed`
- 🐛 many files get re-checked tho no public shape has changed

data.body:
- open markers view and expand a few
- press <kbd>Cmd+F</kbd> in the hope of being brought to the search box
- ⚡ in the active editor the find box shows

Safari

Change the theme to High Contrast and text looks fuzzy

data.title: Files: logic to open dirty editor does not work well for many edits
data.body: Should optimize https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/browser/fileTracker.ts#L91 for the case of many dirty at once.

data.title: Theme dropdown should be re-placed appropriately
data.body:
#8229

Safari

In https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/index.html 

There are two sections, 1.Editor and 2.Diff Editor
First section has two dropdown - Language and Theme
Language dropdown applies only to Editor where as Theme applies to both sections.

May be we should re-place themes dropdown at a place where it is known to be applied for both sections

data.title: Fix emmet error decoding DataURI without workspace
data.body:
Source: #8316

If the user wants to decoding the image without open workspace, then just show a warning.

data.title: Replace: removing last match of a file should not show "no matches"
data.body:
Refs: #8184

Instead it should just be removed from the list as long as I am in replace mode.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/16416449/951a2c1c-3d42-11e6-9870-81d890666283.png)

Same for when applying a replacement.

data.title: Undo action on Find/Replace widget should undo in the editor
data.body:
#8229

Safari

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Find/Replace widget
2. Type a find term and replace term
3. Press Enter to replace
4. Do undo

Expected: This should undo the replace
Actual: This is calling browser undo

data.title: [debug] variables hovers switches between type and value hover
data.body:
- Follow steps https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8199
- Move mouse over a variable name and move it slowly to name below
- observe that the hover shows first a name, then the value then the next name. Looks strange, should only show types.

data.title: Replace: Pressing enter in replace input field should invoke the replace all action
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8184

Since you get a confirm dialog anyways, I think that is fine to do!

Maybe if you do not yet have any search results we run the search on enter?

data.title: Outline issues with Twistie in Find and replace widget
data.body:
#8229

Safari

Steps to Reproduce:
In Monaco Editor
1. Ctrl + F to open Find and replace widget
2. Shift Tab to select Twistie button

Expected: Outline on Twistie button should be complete
Actual: Not properly outlined

data.title: Terminal settings per OS not alligned with rest of vscode
data.body:
#8222
1. Open settings.json and checkout terminal settings
2. Notice how there are 3x some settings for each OS
3. This is not alligned with rest of vscode (tasks.json, launch.json) where a user can specify an OS as field of a setting. By doing this we will not have so many settings for the terminal which will make it more compact and easier to read.

e.g

``` json
 "terminal.integrated.shell": {
  "osx": "lala",
  "linux": "asdasd"
}
```

![screen shot 2016-06-28 at 14 52 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16415921/05c97ede-3d40-11e6-8282-817038cb7c2b.png)

data.title: Monaco Editor / CSS: Intellisense for variables is not using 'var'
data.body:
#8229

Safari

Steps to Reproduce:
In Monaco Editor
1. Change the Language to css
2. Write a :root rule with a variable declaration
3. In other rules, use Intellisense to select the above variable

Expected: Intellisense should set var(--variable)
Actual: Intellisense is placing let(--variable)

data.title: Debugger: after step into with source maps current line not highlighted
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8193:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10.

Testing new source map handling. See attached screen shot: I stepped into onDidCloseTextDocument and the TS code was properly shown but the current line didn't get highlighted.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/16415911/fa93e770-3d3f-11e6-8026-a2333caf2149.png)

Selecting onDidCloseTextDocument in the Call Stack highlights correctly

data.title: Terminal does not support ballistic scroll
data.body:
#8222
1. Open integrated terminal with lots of output
2. Use the trackpad to scroll a lot
3. Notice how the terminal does not respect the balistic scroll - e.g it always scrolls the same not matter how strong I scrolled

data.title: Integrated terminal always eats up tab key
data.body:
#8222
1. It is not possible to tab out of the terminal which can make it hard for keyboard accessibilty
2. This also makes the actions in the terminal header not accessible by keyboard

The editor has a command to use tab key for moving focus, maybe something similar is needed for the terminal.

data.title: [decorations] TextDecoration#after not working?
uppercase/lowercase string - use String.toUppercase() etc.
data.body:
Hi All,

Can we make available some text manipulation functions - this is routine stuff, e.g., even the JavaScript console supports uppercasing the string:

``` javascript
'some_string'.toUpperCase()
"SOME_STRING"
```

I can write the code myself to do this as long as it ends up in the core of the editor.

data.title: Integrated terminal does not support screen readers

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
#8222
1. Turn on some screen reader (voice over on mac)
2. open our integrated terminal -> any action you do the screen reader is silent
3. I would expect that the screen reader reads out what is typed and the output of commands (similar to how it is done for terminal or iTerm on mac)

Install counters should be more proeminent

data.title: Horizontal resize screws up horizontal terminal layout
data.body:
#8222
1. Open integrated terminal - run some scripts which uses all the horizontal space
2. Resize vscode window horizontaly - notice how the terminal will shrink but will never re-grow
3. I would expect the terminal grows horizontally as do the other terminals

![terminalresize](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16415218/77d8f06c-3d3c-11e6-83b5-f6a56c4554f4.gif)

data.title: Replace: preview diff does not update when removing individual replacements from the view
data.body:
Refs: #8184

The diff editor does not show me the correct picture if I start to remove individual replacements from the search viewlet.

data.title: Markdown preview should be able to render images
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.1
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Preview a Markdown image with a simple link to an image in the same folder
2. You get a broken image.
